docs.summary: Creates a new review using a contact ID.
description:
This function requires a [`review.author.contactId`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-crm-v2/contacts).

If the review author does not have a contact ID, use [createReviewAndContact](#createReviewAndContact).

params.name: namespace
params.doc: Namespace where the review is created.

params.name: entityId
params.doc: ID of the entity to review.

docs.summary: Creates a new review and a new contact.
description:
When the review author is not a contact, use this function. Include `name` and `email`, as they're required to create the contact. If these parameters are missing, a new contact and review won't be created.


When the review author is already a contact, use either this function or [createReview](#createReview). A new review is created but a new contact is not created.


After a review is created, it may require [moderation](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-reviews-v2/introduction#moderation).

examples.title: createReviewAndContact example
body: async function createReviewAndContact(namespace, entityId, content, options) {
const result = await reviews.createReviewAndContact(namespace, entityId, content, options);

params.name: options
params.doc: Information about the reviews to retrieve.

description: To include unpublished reviews, pass `returnPrivateReviews` as `true`. By default, unpublished reviews are not returned.

params.name: options
params.doc: Information about the reviews to retrieve.

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of  reviews.
description: The `queryReview` function builds a query to retrieve a list of reviews  and returns a [`ReviewsQueryBuilder`](#reviewsquerybuilder) object.
The returned object contains the query definition, which is typically used to run the query using the  [`find()`](#reviewsquerybuilder/find) function.
You can refine the query by chaining `ReviewsQueryBuilder` functions onto the query.
`ReviewsQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter,
`queryReviews` runs with these `ReviewsQueryBuilder` defaults,  which you can override:

The functions that are chained to `queryReviews()` are applied in the order they're called. For example, if you apply `descending('_createdDate')` and then `descending('content.rating')`, the results are sorted first by the `_createdDate`, and then, if there are multiple results with the same `_createdDate`, the items are sorted by `content.rating`.

Each time the review is updated, `revision` increments by 1. The existing `revision` must be included
when updating the review. This ensures you're working with the latest review information, and it prevents unintended overwrites.

examples.title: updateReview example
body: const result = await reviews.updateReview(id, review, options);

members.name: appDefId
members.doc: App Def Id of moderated content owner vertical, if not provided, will be taken from CallScope

members.name: contentRevision
members.doc: optional content revision supplied and managed by vertical

members.name: totalFailures
members.doc: Number of items that couldn't be processed.

members.name: totalSuccesses
members.doc: Number of items that were successfully processed.

members.name: undetailedFailures
members.doc: Number of failures without details because detailed failure threshold was exceeded.

members.name: reviews
members.doc:
Created reviews, only returned if returnEntity is set to true.
Items are returned for successful operations and when returnEntity in the request is set to true.

members.name: classifierValues
members.doc: classifier values that apply to content (i.e. Blog categories)

members.name: deepLink
members.doc: optional deep link to content in vertical ui

members.name: storedContentId
members.doc: content id stored in the future (rich) content server

members.name: storedContentId
members.doc: content id stored in the future (rich) content server

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address of the review author.  Required for 3rd-party apps.

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the review author. Displayed as part of the review. Required for 3rd-party apps.

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address of the review author.  Required for 3rd-party apps.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity to review.

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the review author. Displayed as part of the review. Required for 3rd-party apps.

members.name: namespace
members.doc: Namespace where the review is created.

members.name: cursor
members.doc: Cursor returned in last query response. Should not be provided on first page request.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
The number of items to load. Cursor token returned in the query response. To be used on the next query request, but not the first query request. Max: `100`
Default: `50`

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next result page.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous result page.

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: returnPrivateReviews
members.doc:
Whether to return private (unpublished) reviews.

Default: `false`

members.name: returnPrivateReviews
members.doc:
Whether to return private (unpublished) reviews.

Default: `false`

members.name: _id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

description: to be replaced by commons wix.common.Link once merged
Media item associated with the review.
Deprecated - Copy this message into your service, do not reference it

members.name: manuallyChanged
members.doc:
Indicates whether a moderator manually changed the `moderationStatus` of the review.

If the `moderationStatus` changed automatically because the review
passed the moderation rules or if moderation is turned off, this field is set to `false`.

members.name: moderationStatus
members.doc:
- `APPROVED`: The review is approved and published.
- `IN_MODERATION`: The review is pending moderation. Moderation can be applied in the site owner's [Dashboard](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Freviews/pending).
- `REJECTED`: The review is rejected and deleted from the site.
- `SUBMITTED`: Initial status of the review before the moderation process.

description: Action describing changed review moderation status

members.name: appId
members.doc:
The app ID of the APP review origin.
Set only when the review origin is APP.

members.name: type
members.doc: The type of the review origin.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: classifierValues
members.doc: classifier values that apply to parent (i.e. Blog categories)

members.name: classifiersUnknown
members.doc: classifier values for parent are not known and should be queried from SPI for parent if possible

members.name: returnPrivateReviews
members.doc:
Whether to return private (unpublished) reviews.

Default: `false`

members.name: returnPrivateReviews
members.doc:
Whether to return private (unpublished) reviews.

Default: `false`

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the reply was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the reply was updated.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the review was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the review was updated.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity to review. For example, a Wix Stores product ID.

members.name: foundHelpful
members.doc: Number of site visitors who found the review helpful.

members.name: foundUnhelpful
members.doc: Number of site visitors who found the review unhelpful.

members.name: helpfulness
members.doc:
Helpfulness score.

Calculated by subtracting `foundUnhelpful` from `foundHelpful`.

members.name: namespace
members.doc: Review namespace. Currently integrated with Wix Stores, as `stores`.

members.name: origin
members.doc:
Provides information about the origin of the review.
Organic reviews are created by site visitors or members.
App reviews are created by apps even though a site visitor or member is the author of the review.
Apps can not create or update organic reviews.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the review is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes,
the current revision must be passed when updating the review.
Ignored when creating a review.

members.name: verified
members.doc: Indicates whether the review has been verified through a Verify Product Purchase call to the Review Product catalog SPI.

description:
A Review object includes all of the details related to the review of an entity. An entity is a specific resource to be reviewed,
for example, a store product.
You can manage existing reviews, create new reviews, and retrieve reviews.
Read more about reviews in this [tutorial](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-setting-up-wix-reviews).

members.name: media
members.doc:
List of media items associated with the review.

Max: 10 items

members.name: rating
members.doc:
Rating of the review.

Min: `1`

Max: `5`

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the review was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the review was updated.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity to review. For example, a Wix Stores product ID.

members.name: foundHelpful
members.doc: Number of site visitors who found the review helpful.

members.name: foundUnhelpful
members.doc: Number of site visitors who found the review unhelpful.

members.name: helpfulness
members.doc:
Helpfulness score.

Calculated by subtracting `foundUnhelpful` from `foundHelpful`.

members.name: namespace
members.doc: Review namespace. Currently integrated with Wix Stores, as `stores`.

members.name: origin
members.doc:
Provides information about the origin of the review.
Organic reviews are created by site visitors or members.
App reviews are created by apps even though a site visitor or member is the author of the review.
Apps can not create or update organic reviews.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the review is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes,
the current revision must be passed when updating the review.
Ignored when creating a review.

members.name: verified
members.doc: Indicates whether the review has been verified through a Verify Product Purchase call to the Review Product catalog SPI.

members.name: fieldMask
members.doc:
Fieldmask for update.
Supported fields: content.title, content.body, content.media, content.rating

members.name: fieldMask
members.doc:
Fieldmask for update.
Supported fields: content.title, content.body, content.media, content.rating

members.name: format
members.doc: Video format for example, mp4, hls.

members.doc: array of permission ids or member groups that can be used with isPermitted to check content visibility
